citation.article-title: Angustibacter luteus gen. nov., sp. nov., isolated from subarctic forest soil
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Angustibacter luteus sp. nov.
Angustibacter luteus (lu′te.us. L. masc. adj. luteus orange-coloured).
Displays the properties of the genus with the following additions.
Cells are usually 0.3–0.5 μm wide and 0.3–2.0 μm long, and rarely up to 5 μm long.
The pH range for growth is 6 to 8 (optimum 6 to 7).
Growth does not occur in the presence of 1 % (w/v) NaCl on yeast extract-starch agar.

Arbutin, cellobiose, aesculin, ferric citrate, d-fructose, gentiobiose, d-glucose, glycerol, lactose, d-lyxose, maltose, d-mannose, melibiose, d-raffinose, l-rhamnose, d-ribose, salicin, starch, sucrose, trehalose, turanose and d-xylose are used as sole carbon source, but d-adonitol, amygdalin, d-arabinose, l-arabinose, d-arabitol, l-arabitol, dulcitol, erythritol, d-fucose, l-fucose, d-galactose, 5-keto-gluconate, methyl α-d-glucopyranoside, N-acetylglucosamine, glycogen, inositol, inulin, d-mannitol, d-melezitose, methyl α-d-mannopyranoside, d-sorbitol, l-sorbose, d-tagatose, methyl β-d-xylopyranoside, xylitol and l-xylose are not assimilated.

β-Galactosidase, α-glucosidase, aesculin hydrolysis, gelatin hydrolysis, esterase lipase (C-8), leucine aminopeptidase, cystine aminopeptidase, acid phosphatase and α-galactosidase are detected in the API ZYM enzyme assay; tests for pyrazinamidase, pyrrolidonyl arylamidase, β-glucuronidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, urea hydrolysis, alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C-4), valine aminopeptidase, trypsin, chymotrypsin, phosphohydrolase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase are negative.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 70.9 mol%.
The type strain is strain TT07R-79T (=NBRC 105387T =KACC 14249T).
